From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To return to EXEC mode from ROM monitor mode, use the **continue** command in ROM monitor mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: In the following example, the continue command switches the router from ROM monitor to EXEC mode:
ExtraInfo: Use this command to return to EXEC mode from ROM monitor mode, to use the system image instead of reloading. On older platforms, the angle bracket (< >) indicates that the router is in ROM monitor mode. On newer platforms, `rommon number>` is the default ROM monitor prompt. Typically, the router is in ROM monitor mode when you manually load a system image or perform diagnostic tests. Otherwise, the router will most likely never be in this mode.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/caut.gif)---**Caution** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)While in ROM monitor mode, the Cisco IOS system software is suspended until you issue either a reset or the**continue** command.---
